titleStmt.title: A Skeltonicall salutation, or condigne gratulation, and iust vexation of the Spanishe nation that in a bravado, spent many a crusado, in setting forth an armado England to invado.

publicationStmt.publisher: By Ioseph Barnes, and are to bee sold [by T. Cooke in London] in Paules Churchyeard, at the signe of the Tygres head,

notesStmt.note: English and Latin verse in John Skelton's style, on the Spanish Armada.
Includes "A question annexed, touching our sea-fishe, nourished with Spanish bloud" and "Ad regem Hispanum".
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.

place.placeName: London] in Paules Churchyeard, at the signe of the Tygres head
